title: What support or champion is simply the best at stopping enemies?
body: I'm wondering which supports are the best for their hard (soft CC helps, but I'm mainly looking for hard CC) CC, because I'm thinking about theorycrafting a lane where Fiora can go bot and build full AD items to deal around 25% max HP as true damage per vital, while relying on the support to make sure they can't use any abilities or interrupt her.

replies.body:
I've been a support main for a good while so I can give you some solid advice on this. 

Fiora has 2 issues, hard CC locks her down and she can get kited. Morgana fixes both these issues. Morgana's shield will allow Fiora to go in without having to worry about CC. Morgana's Q is a 3 second root, which can allow Fiora to proc up to 2 vitals.

Other options are Blitzcrank, Thresh and Nautilus.

I'd say Braum could work well in a lane with Fiora, as he could straight up block a large portion of the cc you will find in bot lane with his E, and his q is a good slow and if the Fiora does go full ad items she would have enough attack speed to proc the stun alone, although Morg would probably be the better choice for when the teams start grouping, just to stop any cc that just appears on Fiora (Nasus's W is the first that comes to mind as an example)

+1 to Braum, not to mention is Ult could help her position herself. Braums passive again is really good, especially if, like you said, she builds attack speed. E is also really good too.

(Don't know why I repeated what you said... but anyway. +11111111)

In relation to your post, Morgana is probably a prime pick. Lux as well. But overall in terms of "Best at stopping", Bard is technically a beast in that regard. His Q can stun up to two enemies, his meeps/autos slow enemies in a cone and his ultimate is technically the best group CC in the game. But he's hard to use, so that's why someone like Morgana would be a better choice.
You can't hit people under stasis tho...
You asked for best cc, I gave you best cc. :P
Bards ult is near the WORST CC, only beaten by Tahm.

Lol, you know that CC stands for Crowd Control right? You do know that Bard's ult cancels everything the enemy can do right? Crowd control doesn't mean 'slow champs but can still damage/kill them'. Crowd control literally means controlling a crowd of champions, so they can do as little as possible. And none makes them do as little as possible as Bard's ult.

You ult with Bard, your team gets in range and surrounds the enemy. Bard can drop a health pack and get his Q ready to stun two of the enemy champs once they come out of stasis. Then after that, his autos slow and deal damage. All the while, the enemy is UNABLE to do anything. Even with stuns, they can cleanse, or cast certain spells. Bard's ult stops that, and therefore it is the most comprehensive CC there is in the game.

Bard's ult stops allies.

It's best at being CC, but it's the worst CC by controlling the wrong crowd. It's not even the longest CC anyway (Morganna is longer), and is only safer for bard himself while not being as useful in teams when attacking as Ekko (Who has a stun instead)

Thanks for implying I don't have much knowledge in MoBAs, but you can take your attitude elsewhere.

Lol again, the first C in CC stands for Crowd. If it meant Enemy control, it'd be EC, Who knows, maybe it should be. You are right it does statis allies as well. I'm not implying you have no knowledge, I just think you're biased against Bard. Bard is a difficult champion to master and I can tell by your attitude that you've either 1) tried to use Bard and failed or 2) have had him used improperly by someone on your team and ended up with the mental note that he doesn't have the best CC in the game. Watch an LCS level player use him and your bias will go.

As for Morgana's being longer. You are correct. Her stupid snare lasts for 1294758293428847859 billion years, but again, it only snares a single person, which is not a crowd, more just a sausage party of one. :P

I don't judge champions based on anyone's gameplay. Especially not LCS gameplay because doing something simply because pros do it makes no sense and is actually bad as the people who do it assume they can play at LCS level (Tear Udyr, anyone?).

The title is "What support or champion is simply the best at stopping enemies?" Ekko does better, Morganna does better, Bard's ulti has the advantage of being flexible with allies but is completely suboptimal when used offensively, heck, Leona has better cooldowns too.

And as I said, you obviously have never played with anyone who can consistently use his ultimate offensively. Let's not even mention the fact Bard also has 2 other means of CC aside from his ult, something Morgana doesn't have. Even Sion is better than Morgana at CC'ing more than a single target. I'd also say Sion is better overall in general for CC over Bard due to ease of play.

But again, the most complete CC in the game is Bard's ultimate. You really cannot argue with it, and I'm not even going to debate it with you. You are wrong and I am correct. You cannot argue facts lol. Whether it's your opinion on whether it is better or worse in certain circumstances than other champion CC, that's a different story. But in regards to what is the BEST CC in the entire game, Bard's ult is the best.

And I downvoted all your comments as well. Childish you'd down vote mine in a debate, but I'll return the favour in kind. Lol.

You can continue to pretend you're right, but Bard's ult is not the best CC. You can also continue to pretend you're giving 'facts' when all you're saying is "pros do stuff and if you ever criticise bard you're biased"

Lol, don't you know that CC means crowd control? Bard's ult takes away whatever control you have to the crowd of champions, and Ekko has a similar AoE and a slow too.

Finally, Crowd Control is not always AoE, so I don't get why you're saying Morganna is so bad because of your nitpicking with the word crowd while still saying it's a 'crowd of one'

Lol, this is like arguing against a brick wall. I give up. Final statement before I leave this madness behind:

1) Best single piece of CC in the game in terms of sheer power and true nature of 'Crowd Control' is Bard's ultimate. Hard to use, and to go wrong with? Yes. But in terms of the true meaning of CC, it's the best CC in the game. Definitely not what you're looking for in regards to wanting to still do damage while they're CC'd.

2) Good CC champions are Bard, Zac, Sion, Braum, Thresh and champs with long snares like Morg and Lux. Campions like Blitz and Naut are okay with their silence and hooks, but fall short of the others.

Have a nice life.

And somehow the brick wall has a more coherent argument too.

Bard's ultimate is not as long as other CC and your arbitrary measurement for 'Crowd Control' effectiveness doesn't make it any better. His ultimate deliberately has a longer cooldown than other champs with similar CC because his strength lies in the utility of the combined flexibility of putting both allies and enemies in stasis. Using it on enemies only is a waste as you might as well just get the tank (malphite, Maokai, etc) to do that.

Not only that, I didn't specify whether it was "Best CC by The Spawn Man's standards" or "Best CC by situation/duration/cooldown"

Bard's CC is the worst by the specific situation and context of this discussion (stopping _enemies_ specifically) but is good in general usage as not everyone has a Zhonya's and everyone knows how useful that is.

Again, you obviously have never played with anyone who knows how to use Bard's ultimate offensively very well. You're forgetting how extremely long the range of Bard's ultimate is, able to stasis enemies trying to escape from some distance away. That glorious few seconds of stasis allows the rest of your team to catch up and get the kills which otherwise would have escaped behind a tower or back to base.

If you're going to argue about duration, and keep fanning the Morgana fanboy fire, then here's a list of Bard vs Morg: Duration - Morg wins of course, but not by like a massive margin, by a bit. Number - Bard can stasis every single champ in the match if they're in the ult's AoE; Morg can only snare one, with a very narrow skill shot. Range - Bard's ult out-ranges Morg's ult by a country mile. Versatility - Bard can status allies for protection, enemies to stop them escaping or stop their ultimates, towers for protection or tower diving, etc. Morg can snare a single enemy. Cool down - Bard's loses by quite a bit, but with such powerful CC, you only need it once per team fight and they only come once every so often (plus it's an ult, which are meant to take longer). Completeness - Morg's snare can be cleansed, reduced in length with tenacity, even escaped (lantern). Bard's cannot be escaped. You cannot cast anything while in stasis.

Head to head, Bard's is better CC. /argument.

And just to confirm that even the community thinks you're wrong, here is a post I started. Question was, does Bard's ultimate suck? 3 people said best in the game, the rest said it was a good, but not the best. Zero people said i was a the worst in the game like you did.

Ah, it feels so nice to win.

Range doesn't matter. It in no way defines the effectiveness of CC and instead defines how safe it is for the caster.

When you CC someone, what does define the effectiveness of CC is what allies can do that was otherwise inhibited by lack of CC. Being able to attack enemies without response is one. Escaping is another. By hitting both allies and enemies, the effectiveness of that single casting is dependent on what the remaining allies and enemies can do. A bard has less situations to use his ulti offensively because team fights will rarely have their front lines far away from each other unless they're both extremely long range.

Stasis on allies is a completely different subject and has nothing to do with the current context and even the literal wording of the title.

If you're using Bard's ulti offensively only, and thus having the minimum cooldown for offensive CC, you're doing it wrong. Leona has a stun for that, Heimer has a basic ability for that. Ekko, even Soraka has abilities that would be better suited for this purpose. 

By this specific context without any cherry picking on LCS plays, Bard's ult sucks /Actual plausible argument

Also, "Bard can stasis every single champ in the match if they're in the ult's AoE; Morg can only snare one, with a very narrow skill shot. Range - Bard's ult out-ranges Morg's ult by a country mile. "?

Go back to the cherry farms. As if I'd need one long range game pause button rather than 5 enemy stuns in a shorter range.

"Range doesn't matter".

Bahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaahahahahahahaahahahahahahâ€¦ *huff huff* hahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha. Ha.

You are one seriously funny guy. I can't tell if you're trolling or if you're legit this stupid. Range. Doesn't. Matter. That's the argument you're going with here? You're telling me that if you could add double the range to Morg's snare, you wouldn't? Range is always good and the more range, the more options.

Okay, riddle me this, because I honestly have been in this exact situation many times. You've taken part in a quick team fight. You've peeled for your ADC and picked off an enemy. The rest of your team has won their little part of the team fight, and the two remaining enemies that weren't killed have turned and fled. You're too far behind the rest of the team to auto slow them, and they've got a head start on the rest of your team, so what do you do? If only there was some sort of long range, stasis CC that could stop them from escaping by allowing your team to catch up! I mean, if you could do that, it'd be an ace, both a moral and strategic victory.

Oh yeah, Bard's ult. Throw it, stasis the two remaining enemies, let your team catch up, they wipe them off the face of the Rift and you and your adc catch up to take an inhib.

The number of times this *exact* scenario has happened while I've played Bard is countless, and those few seconds of stasis which cannot be cleansed, escaped or prevented, to allow your team to catch up, are the difference between an ace and getting inhibs into Baron, or getting maybe an inhib turret and then getting beaten back by the freshly returned remainder of their team.

What could Morg do in that situation? Nothing. Even if she was closer, right on their heels, she could still ever catch one. Who cares if you can hit the enemy while they're snared; once they come out of a Bard stasis, with a your team waiting outside, they're as good as dead anyway.

cc machine (morgana)
Naughty Naut for sure! I've mained him for a few months now and hes so fun. {{champion:111}}

TL;DR: {{champion:111}} >{{champion:25}} {{champion:267}} 



I'm definitely feeling Nautilus.
Passive - Root enemies for 0.5s -> 1.5s on basics
Q - Hook + brief stun
E - AoE slow
R - AoE knock up and (single target) stun
So a root, hook + stun, slow, knock up and another stun. Das a lot of CC yo

Blitzcrank and Thresh are other contenders but Naut definitely trumps them both. (CC wise)

After them a different approach could be Morgana or Nami?
Morg:
Q - Snare
E - Shield
R - AoE Slow + Stun (if they don't escape it)

Nami:
Passive - Speed Boosts allies
Q - Snare
W - Heal
E - Buff + Slow (your/her attacks slow)
R - Knockup + Slow

Nami is slightly ahead with the amounts of CC but I think Morgs snare lasts longer.
Morg also has the Black Shield to stop you from being CC'd.. but Nami can sustain you, provide speed boosts and buff your damage. So either are good options in my opinion.

Edit: Leona's probably also worth considering.
Q - Stun
E - Root + Gapcloser
R - Slow/Stun

Seems less than the others but boy can she chain those stuns like a boss.
I still think Nauts the best pick but it's worth the consideration ^^
